headline: Greg Gutfeld on Ellen DeGeneres leaving show

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Just another whopper from Mayor McCheese. I’m still grossed out by that. OK. It’s been a few months and Joe Biden has made more mistakes than I did in med school. It’s why I’m not a doctor. Why all of those people are dead. Gets a laugh. All those dead people. All right. Now we could point out all of Joe’s failures, but I have a wedding to go to in September. But what’s weird is how the media buries these stories like cat poo in a sandbox. Where does it all go? Don Lemon’s hamper, Rachel Maddow’s Jim locker, that computer shop where Hunter Biden took his laptop. There’s a lot of bad stuff going on. But like Kamala Harris, the Jimmy Hoffa of vice presidents, it’s nowhere to be found. Biden screws up in the media slips the story between the mattress and the box spring. Like those photos I have of Bill Hemmer. But imagine if any of this happened under President Trump. Highest rate of inflation in 13 years, like Dana Perino hawking her new book, that would be everywhere. Unemployment is now rising faster than it has in a decade and during a job surplus. Has that ever happened before? That’s like losing weight after eating 10 pounds of cookie dough. Relax, Stelter. It’s not possible. As always, it’s all about the incentives. Incentives are the most basic science on Earth. If you’re married, you know what I mean. If you want your wife to stay interested in the bedroom, you do what I do. You put the dishwasher in there. Sadly, the only incentives the Dems understand is if you give someone money, they’ll vote for you. But I was kind of hoping that was changing. Biden has now decided to resume partly building the wall. Yes, that big evil Satan wall. Remember when they stopped building it in January? Every live did a victory dance, including Elizabeth Warren. And I know because it rained over my house for three days. So what happened next, a massive influx of migrants. Thousands of kids showed up unaccompanied and on a school night no less. Incentives took center stage, like a Bunyan on Pelosi’s foot, it got big and ugly fast. But maybe I thought something came to Joe’s senses, probably polling numbers or smelling salts. Or maybe the images of children being abandoned in the mountains like James Franco’s Tinder dates who wouldn’t put out. I was hoping Biden woke up to the fact that not everything Trump did was evil, and that the advice he’s getting from the woke is idiotic. In fact, a lot of Trumps teams were pretty good. If you’re not a communist socialist or something called Debra Messing. Record low unemployment, especially among minorities, energy independence, North Korea no longer and apocalyptic headache, a plethora of peace deals. True Trump could hurt your feelings. Don’t we all know it? I’m still smarting over being snubbed for that Presidential Medal of Freedom. But all of Joe’s current problems are based on rejecting Trumpism which isn’t a way to run a country. It’s like hooking up with a total loser after you got dumped just to get back at the person who dumped you, but it only harms you. However, it’s great if you’re the loser that people keep hooking up with. That was the only way I got lucky in college. I wonder what our angry white male thinks.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, AMERICAN STAND-UP COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: Presidential politics, what a pain. Look, I like the last guy OK. But I know there were a lot of people who didn’t. Look, it seems like the negative voices always outweigh the positive ones. And I don’t want to get involved in all that. Some days, politics really gets me down. Then other days I think, who cares? I just bought this sweet telescope.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just getting angrier every day. So Trump mostly made decisions based on principles of incentives and disincentives. And if it made him look good or bad, who cares? It worked. Trump would never call a looter a protester because that’s an incentive to loot. He never paid people not to work because that’s an incentive not to work. He’d never applaud identity politics, because that’s an incentive to divide. True, he’d make fun of your weight or your hair. But that’s the price you pay for common sense. Plus, you’ve got Frank Luntz to join a gym. I go back to this analogy. When you hire a lawyer, do you want everyone in the court to like him or do you want everyone to go Holy crap, not that guy? Trump was supposed to be America’s lawyer. And he was (BLEEP) but he was (BLEEP) and if there’s one thing we Americans love, it’s (BLEEP).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He’s blushing. Let’s welcome our guests. We always see eye to eye because we’re both wearing heels. America’s newsroom co-anchor and "THE FIVE" co-host, Dana Perino. If looks could kill his face would be on trial for a murder. America’s newsroom co-anchor Bill Hemmer. He was valedictorian of his driver’s ed class, host of the Guy Benson Show on Fox News Radio, Guy Benson. She’s returned to everything from her wedding, including her husband. Fox News Contributor Kat Timpf. Dana, can you explain to me what I just read or what just happened? I thought that they were actually going to rebuild the wall but turns out they’re only going to build on the levees.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, you know, I mean, you would -- I understand why you would get excited because it would make sense. And sense is like you’d like common sense. So here’s the deal. Down there at the border, lots of flooding can happen. So there’s a levee system. But President Trump said is since there’s already a levee system, let’s just put the wall that we’re continuing to build on top of that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because that will save taxpayers money. It’s already approved environmentally, and we can just go ahead and do that. But then they stop the wall. But they still need the levees.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So they’re going to do the levees, but not the wall. Which doesn’t make sense.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It doesn’t make sense.

utterances.speaker: BILL HEMMER, FOX NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: How much sense does she make though?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Holy cow.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I get these five days a week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. No wonder you’re going crazy. Must be driving you nuts. I went through this too. It’s terrible. Are you tired of the dog yet?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He hasn’t met -- I mean, Jasper’s, you know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You haven’t met Jasper yet?

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I have met Jasper.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUY BENSON, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: And she has a dog?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Jasper is like -- Jasper is kind of like the size of a construction worker who wants to sit on your lap. So when he climbs up on top of you it’s -- I don’t know --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He’s totally ripped right now too. OK. He looks great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Tell me more. You know, I feel like I should be see -- every time I hear levy. I just feel like I should be singing American Pie.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Probably. I thought it was a great explanation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I think it’s the rainy season down there. You got to make sure it’s taken care of. I feel like though this is like red eye on steroids. I mean, what did I just drop into? Huh? I mean, how about the upgrade for Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Which is actually pretty nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. It’s a nice studio. I like it. It’s like Bill’s never watched the show before.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He’s going, what his place? Am I on in a spaceship?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He kept commenting on the studio. It’s like, thanks for your support, Bill Hemmer.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: During the opening mono, I’m looking over at Hemmer and he looks like he’s -- like where are the exits? Like if I had to go to a break for, like they show it Gutfeld exclamation point to the Gutfeld question mark.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know what the problem was. It was the -- it was the dishwasher with Joe.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dishwasher one. I wanted to know what his dream was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Oh. Oh, wow. That is a good Joe. That’s a good joke.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I was joking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kat?

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What are your thoughts? Oh, here’s the theory. I believe that Biden is truly the opposite of Trump and that Trump was bad words good deeds. But Biden is nice words no deeds.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Or bad deeds.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: The policies are awful and things are terrible. But it’s worse than that. Because much like my string of unemployed ex-boyfriends, in addition to things going terribly. They’re also incredibly expensive to maintain.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Right? Like he spent almost $150 billion on education. Like doubling the Department of Education’s budget. It’s not even just, oh, kids are doing poorly in school and kids aren’t even in school at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: So it’s really bad, things are bad and it costs a lot of money. Not worth it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Guy, I know that you were -- you were you were critical of Trump. Don’t you kind of miss the mean tweets in the $2.00 gas?

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: Definitely the cheaper gas, definitely most of the policies. And I think part of the frustration for a lot of normal people who are not completely obsessed with hating Donald Trump or hating Joe Biden is this weird obsession with doing exactly the opposite.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: It’s like, well, if that was a Trump-related thing, we have to make that anathema. It’s, you know, out of bounds, we can’t do it. And therefore some good policy just went overboard, and it’s just pure signaling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: And it’s stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: I know that this was the smart power crew, it’s what they call themselves under Obama. This is stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. This is what spouses do, Dana, like when you’re planning a fun night out and you get into a little tiff and then it’s like, oh, we’re not going. That’s it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It’s like -- it’s like --

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: That hurts all of us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. They go so extremes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That actually does drive me crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It drives me nuts. It drives me nuts. I never do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you know what great though? I’m always glad when something gets canceled. No, no, but we had plans to go to the opera.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: You know when they go in the first place.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I thought the biggest whopper of the week on the border was what the head of the DHS said this week, from the White House. He said the borders close.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Probably have film illusions video.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He was thinking about the bookstore. OK. It’s an old joke. I don’t care at this point. You know, you got -- you got some winners in that monologue. So, don’t complain about an old joke. All right. We got to move on. Up next, which state Govs are a cut above? That’s next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Meet the Govs who deserve our loves.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They spent three weeks on that. So, the criteria for this is very strict. Mostly don’t lock people inside or kill the elderly. Anything after that is awesome. First up is Governor Mike DeWine of the Buckeye State. A nickname that I just came up with. He’s ending Ohio’s COVID orders as of June 2nd, I hope this is true. And that includes the mask mandate and distancing in restaurants. Also, teenage boys can return to practicing French kissing on their fist.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: At least three.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That’s tasteless, too. I wrote that one. That’s three weeks for more people to get vaccinated. And he’s got a plan for that too. He’s holding a lottery with five cash prizes of a million bucks each. Any adults who’s had at least one vaccine dose can enter and he’s paying for it with federal pandemic relief funds. Here’s DeWine explaining the reason for the move.

utterances.speaker: GOV. MIKE DEWINE (R-OH)
utterances.sentences: You’ve got people who clearly are not going to get it. They have every right to make that decision. But then you have people in the middle and they’re the kind of persuadable people and they’re people who may have just put it off. Some people are going to say Mike DeWine is crazy and that this is a big waste of money. But I’ll tell you what the real waste is. What the real waste is when somebody at this stage when we have the vaccine that will pretty much 100 percent protect you but you don’t take it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I’m going to look like him in 10 years. To tell you right -- I can tell you that right now. Anyway, meanwhile, in Florida, the birthplace of Hooters, Guy. Governor Ron DeSantis will pardon anyone charged for not wearing masks or socially distancing. The move came a day before the CDC announced fully vaccinated people could stop wearing masks indoors. He announced it on live T.V. to a couple facing jail time for letting people forgo masks at their gym.

utterances.speaker: GOV. RON DESANTIS (R-FL)
utterances.sentences: When our clemency board meets in the coming weeks, we’ll issue pardons not only for Mike and Jillian, but for any Floridian that may have outstanding infractions for things like mass and social distancing. These things with hell should be advisory, they should not be punitive.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hmm. That looks like a hell of a T.V. program. Anyway, that couple was facing 120 days in jail which isn’t so bad because in prison, you can always catch up on your reading. Did you see the book Dana wrote before everything’s going to be OK? It was called everything sucks and I’m going to murder you. And it also was a best seller. All right. So Bill, what are your thoughts on the lottery?

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: We had him on our program this morning. Governor DeWine. I think they started aiming a little too high on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I mean, you’re starting at a million?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Why don’t we start at like 10 grand and see what kind of reaction you get then maybe work your way up. They probably have done the science where they know that they’ll get more -- more people are suckers for more money.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I get it. But these are -- these are -- these are taxpayer dollars that you’re saying we’re going to give out a million dollars a week for everybody that gets vaccinated.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. But is it really -- I mean, we could just print more money, Kat.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Who does that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don’t know. But I mean, just put it.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: You can’t give it back though. This is money that they were already given for COVID Relief Fund. And so when I saw this, I was like, this is super dumb. And now I think it’s dumb, but it’s not his fault. Because you can’t just give it back to the taxpayers. That’s not allowed. So, he found a way to sort of kind of do that. And incentivizing vaccines is the best thing you can do because that’s the best, clearest, scientifically backed path to going back to normal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that’s true. Guy, what did you make of this?

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: I want to clear for the record. I actually did eat at Hooters for the food. It’s like I would.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Oh, you were the guy.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: Reading a Playboy for the articles.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: And Hooters for the food. That’s me for real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Ate wings.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: Wings and beer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that’s what they call them.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: And sports.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: Other things.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh yes, I love -- I love the sports.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: I actually do love sport.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Baseball and the basketball. I do love sweaty men running up and down the field. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: No, it’s OK. You’re lost in a moment there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: I want to let you hold on to it for just a second and go back to your wife. Now here’s the thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. At least he didn’t use air quotes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: For her wife? So, I think this is actually a brilliant idea. And I’ll say that I don’t hate it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: Because you’re right, the money is spent. You could argue it’s wasteful, but it’s already out there. And the data shows you’ve got most people who either have the vaccine already or are lining up to do it. You’ve got a handful of folks like 20 percent or so who were saying we’re not getting this period. Then as DeWine was saying, the governor, there’s this group of persuadables, they’re not ideological, they don’t care about politics. They’re not going to respond to like, typical, you know, PSAs and that sort of thing. You’ve got to give them something non-ideological. And what is more universal than you might win a million dollars like oh, you know, that gets my attention. I’m already vaccinated. I might do it again, if it’s necessary, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It’s publisher’s clearing house.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: OK. But with this money, I mean, DeWine is get in line to the -- start cutting back on the unemployment payments, just like a lot of these other states are doing.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: And I ate the wings at Hooters too. I was a fan. Blue cheese.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you know what the best thing about Hooters was they really revolutionized pantyhose with shorts. I mean, I thought I was just the one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, but did you find that comfortable?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Sometimes it -- sometimes it ran up when I was running at night. But, you know, let’s get away from what I do in my private time in the park. What -- is it using a lottery for other things? Like to use a lottery as a way to force people to focus on things. Like what if --what if you were a politician and you said, you vote for me or you support my campaign and one of you will win a million dollars? Like if you had the money like you could -- it’s like a Ponzi scheme. Everybody puts money in but you’re going to give it out. You can --

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: That would be illegal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. That would be bribery, I would think, buying votes. But I think -- here’s a couple things. One is going to make sure that this money will be better spent in Ohio by whoever wins it and it was going to be spent by the government and something our producer said in our ear this morning and I thought was smart is actually the taxpayers, federal taxpayers that put this money in will get some back because that money is taxable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, they’ll get 50 percent of it back which will go to some lousy government program.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Could go to a levy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hmm. But that levy was dry. And they were singing.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Again. Bye-bye, Miss American.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Boy, that song drove me crazy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It goes on for so long.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Yes. 17 minutes long.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And we have more of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And it’s in -- and it’s in every Irish bar in D.C. If you go to -- if you went to Iowa there’s always some guy up there singing it, these drunk sorority girls throwing up on your feet.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: Another verse. Thank god.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes. All right. That wrap in me. OK. Still to come, should we be complaining about woke army training? See their latest ad next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Will woke troops lack the will to attack? The U.S. Army’s latest recruitment campaign is creating quite the buzz for leaning hard into wokeness. It’s got it all, same sex parenting, overcoming gender stereotypes, equal rights marches. Ew. Kidding. You know, typical battlefield preparation. Check it out.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It begins in California, with a little girl raised by two moms. Although I had a fairly typical childhood also marched for equality. When I was six years old, one of my moms had an accident that left her paralyzed. Doctor said she might never walk again. Eventually standing at the altar to marry my other mom. I began feeling like I’d been handed so much in life, a sorority girl stereotype but what had I really achieved on my own? I needed my own adventures, my own challenge. And after meeting with an army recruiter, I found it. A way to prove my inner strength and maybe shatter some stereotypes along the way. I’m U.S. Army Corporal Emma Malonelord and I answered my calling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go. Now let’s compare that to what the Russians are putting out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesus. Oh my God. By Russian is a little rusty? But the scared the thought -- I actually thought that the first ad wasn’t bad but it’s very touchy feely. Should we be embarrassed about our privates?

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: Look, I found the cartoon animation to be a little bit strange. I think that just as an American citizen, I’m more concerned about military readiness than equality or inclusiveness. I don’t think that they’re mutually exclusive though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: What I was distracted by was this wedding. And you can ask Kat, I will attend any wedding even if I’m not technically invited.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: So, I kind of want to go hang out at a wedding like that. That seems sort of appealing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now, you were a cat’s wedding, weren’t you?

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: I was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: The flower girl was a guy. So --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, the flower girl was a guy.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: In heels. And it was not, just to clarify.

utterances.speaker: BILL HEMMER, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: So, the flower girl was not god, it was not it was a guy.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.sentences: It was one of her, one of her buddies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, let’s try to get back on point, Bill. I don’t know you have to (INAUDIBLE) these topics.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: My feeling is, I mean, half of me thinks whatever works. And half of me thinks I, you know, there’s a lot of tough Marines who want to eat your face.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: And probably will go for a different spot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, what do you, so how do you -- I mean, if you were in charge, which ad would you prefer to use?

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: I would use option number two.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: And I’d say (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, wow.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The only Russian you know,

utterances.utterance: He hasn’t met -- I mean, Jasper’s, you know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You haven’t met Jasper yet?

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I have met Jasper.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUY BENSON, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: And she has a dog?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Jasper is like -- Jasper is kind of like the size of a construction worker who wants to sit on your lap. So when he climbs up on top of you it’s -- I don’t know --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He’s totally ripped right now too. OK. He looks great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Tell me more. You know, I feel like I should be see -- every time I hear levy. I just feel like I should be singing American Pie.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Probably. I thought it was a great explanation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I think it’s the rainy season down there. You got to make sure it’s taken care of. I feel like though this is like red eye on steroids. I mean, what did I just drop into? Huh? I mean, how about the upgrade for Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Which is actually pretty nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. It’s a nice studio. I like it. It’s like Bill’s never watched the show before.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He’s going, what his place? Am I on in a spaceship?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He kept commenting on the studio. It’s like, thanks for your support, Bill Hemmer.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: During the opening mono, I’m looking over at Hemmer and he looks like he’s -- like where are the exits? Like if I had to go to a break for, like they show it Gutfeld exclamation point to the Gutfeld question mark.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know what the problem was. It was the -- it was the dishwasher with Joe.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Dishwasher one. I wanted to know what his dream was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Oh. Oh, wow. That is a good Joe. That’s a good joke.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I was joking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat?

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are your thoughts? Oh, here’s the theory. I believe that Biden is truly the opposite of Trump and that Trump was bad words good deeds. But Biden is nice words no deeds.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or bad deeds.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: The policies are awful and things are terrible. But it’s worse than that. Because much like my string of unemployed ex-boyfriends, in addition to things going terribly. They’re also incredibly expensive to maintain.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Right? Like he spent almost $150 billion on education. Like doubling the Department of Education’s budget. It’s not even just, oh, kids are doing poorly in school and kids aren’t even in school at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: So it’s really bad, things are bad and it costs a lot of money. Not worth it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Guy, I know that you were -- you were you were critical of Trump. Don’t you kind of miss the mean tweets in the $2.00 gas?

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: Definitely the cheaper gas, definitely most of the policies. And I think part of the frustration for a lot of normal people who are not completely obsessed with hating Donald Trump or hating Joe Biden is this weird obsession with doing exactly the opposite.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: It’s like, well, if that was a Trump-related thing, we have to make that anathema. It’s, you know, out of bounds, we can’t do it. And therefore some good policy just went overboard, and it’s just pure signaling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: And it’s stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: I know that this was the smart power crew, it’s what they call themselves under Obama. This is stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. This is what spouses do, Dana, like when you’re planning a fun night out and you get into a little tiff and then it’s like, oh, we’re not going. That’s it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It’s like -- it’s like --

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: That hurts all of us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. They go so extremes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That actually does drive me crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It drives me nuts. It drives me nuts. I never do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you know what great though? I’m always glad when something gets canceled. No, no, but we had plans to go to the opera.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: You know when they go in the first place.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I thought the biggest whopper of the week on the border was what the head of the DHS said this week, from the White House. He said the borders close.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Probably have film illusions video.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He was thinking about the bookstore. OK. It’s an old joke. I don’t care at this point. You know, you got -- you got some winners in that monologue. So, don’t complain about an old joke. All right. We got to move on. Up next, which state Govs are a cut above? That’s next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Meet the Govs who deserve our loves.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They spent three weeks on that. So, the criteria for this is very strict. Mostly don’t lock people inside or kill the elderly. Anything after that is awesome. First up is Governor Mike DeWine of the Buckeye State. A nickname that I just came up with. He’s ending Ohio’s COVID orders as of June 2nd, I hope this is true. And that includes the mask mandate and distancing in restaurants. Also, teenage boys can return to practicing French kissing on their fist.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: At least three.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That’s tasteless, too. I wrote that one. That’s three weeks for more people to get vaccinated. And he’s got a plan for that too. He’s holding a lottery with five cash prizes of a million bucks each. Any adults who’s had at least one vaccine dose can enter and he’s paying for it with federal pandemic relief funds. Here’s DeWine explaining the reason for the move.

utterances.speaker: GOV. MIKE DEWINE (R-OH)
utterances.utterance: You’ve got people who clearly are not going to get it. They have every right to make that decision. But then you have people in the middle and they’re the kind of persuadable people and they’re people who may have just put it off. Some people are going to say Mike DeWine is crazy and that this is a big waste of money. But I’ll tell you what the real waste is. What the real waste is when somebody at this stage when we have the vaccine that will pretty much 100 percent protect you but you don’t take it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I’m going to look like him in 10 years. To tell you right -- I can tell you that right now. Anyway, meanwhile, in Florida, the birthplace of Hooters, Guy. Governor Ron DeSantis will pardon anyone charged for not wearing masks or socially distancing. The move came a day before the CDC announced fully vaccinated people could stop wearing masks indoors. He announced it on live T.V. to a couple facing jail time for letting people forgo masks at their gym.

utterances.speaker: GOV. RON DESANTIS (R-FL)
utterances.utterance: When our clemency board meets in the coming weeks, we’ll issue pardons not only for Mike and Jillian, but for any Floridian that may have outstanding infractions for things like mass and social distancing. These things with hell should be advisory, they should not be punitive.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hmm. That looks like a hell of a T.V. program. Anyway, that couple was facing 120 days in jail which isn’t so bad because in prison, you can always catch up on your reading. Did you see the book Dana wrote before everything’s going to be OK? It was called everything sucks and I’m going to murder you. And it also was a best seller. All right. So Bill, what are your thoughts on the lottery?

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: We had him on our program this morning. Governor DeWine. I think they started aiming a little too high on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I mean, you’re starting at a million?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Why don’t we start at like 10 grand and see what kind of reaction you get then maybe work your way up. They probably have done the science where they know that they’ll get more -- more people are suckers for more money.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I get it. But these are -- these are -- these are taxpayer dollars that you’re saying we’re going to give out a million dollars a week for everybody that gets vaccinated.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. But is it really -- I mean, we could just print more money, Kat.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Who does that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don’t know. But I mean, just put it.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You can’t give it back though. This is money that they were already given for COVID Relief Fund. And so when I saw this, I was like, this is super dumb. And now I think it’s dumb, but it’s not his fault. Because you can’t just give it back to the taxpayers. That’s not allowed. So, he found a way to sort of kind of do that. And incentivizing vaccines is the best thing you can do because that’s the best, clearest, scientifically backed path to going back to normal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that’s true. Guy, what did you make of this?

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: I want to clear for the record. I actually did eat at Hooters for the food. It’s like I would.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Oh, you were the guy.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: Reading a Playboy for the articles.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: And Hooters for the food. That’s me for real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ate wings.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: Wings and beer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that’s what they call them.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: And sports.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: Other things.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh yes, I love -- I love the sports.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: I actually do love sport.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Baseball and the basketball. I do love sweaty men running up and down the field. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: No, it’s OK. You’re lost in a moment there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: I want to let you hold on to it for just a second and go back to your wife. Now here’s the thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. At least he didn’t use air quotes.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: For her wife? So, I think this is actually a brilliant idea. And I’ll say that I don’t hate it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: Because you’re right, the money is spent. You could argue it’s wasteful, but it’s already out there. And the data shows you’ve got most people who either have the vaccine already or are lining up to do it. You’ve got a handful of folks like 20 percent or so who were saying we’re not getting this period. Then as DeWine was saying, the governor, there’s this group of persuadables, they’re not ideological, they don’t care about politics. They’re not going to respond to like, typical, you know, PSAs and that sort of thing. You’ve got to give them something non-ideological. And what is more universal than you might win a million dollars like oh, you know, that gets my attention. I’m already vaccinated. I might do it again, if it’s necessary, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It’s publisher’s clearing house.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: OK. But with this money, I mean, DeWine is get in line to the -- start cutting back on the unemployment payments, just like a lot of these other states are doing.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: And I ate the wings at Hooters too. I was a fan. Blue cheese.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you know what the best thing about Hooters was they really revolutionized pantyhose with shorts. I mean, I thought I was just the one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean, but did you find that comfortable?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Sometimes it -- sometimes it ran up when I was running at night. But, you know, let’s get away from what I do in my private time in the park. What -- is it using a lottery for other things? Like to use a lottery as a way to force people to focus on things. Like what if --what if you were a politician and you said, you vote for me or you support my campaign and one of you will win a million dollars? Like if you had the money like you could -- it’s like a Ponzi scheme. Everybody puts money in but you’re going to give it out. You can --

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: That would be illegal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. That would be bribery, I would think, buying votes. But I think -- here’s a couple things. One is going to make sure that this money will be better spent in Ohio by whoever wins it and it was going to be spent by the government and something our producer said in our ear this morning and I thought was smart is actually the taxpayers, federal taxpayers that put this money in will get some back because that money is taxable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, they’ll get 50 percent of it back which will go to some lousy government program.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Could go to a levy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hmm. But that levy was dry. And they were singing.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Again. Bye-bye, Miss American.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Boy, that song drove me crazy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It goes on for so long.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Yes. 17 minutes long.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And we have more of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And it’s in -- and it’s in every Irish bar in D.C. If you go to -- if you went to Iowa there’s always some guy up there singing it, these drunk sorority girls throwing up on your feet.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Another verse. Thank god.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes. All right. That wrap in me. OK. Still to come, should we be complaining about woke army training? See their latest ad next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Will woke troops lack the will to attack? The U.S. Army’s latest recruitment campaign is creating quite the buzz for leaning hard into wokeness. It’s got it all, same sex parenting, overcoming gender stereotypes, equal rights marches. Ew. Kidding. You know, typical battlefield preparation. Check it out.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It begins in California, with a little girl raised by two moms. Although I had a fairly typical childhood also marched for equality. When I was six years old, one of my moms had an accident that left her paralyzed. Doctor said she might never walk again. Eventually standing at the altar to marry my other mom. I began feeling like I’d been handed so much in life, a sorority girl stereotype but what had I really achieved on my own? I needed my own adventures, my own challenge. And after meeting with an army recruiter, I found it. A way to prove my inner strength and maybe shatter some stereotypes along the way. I’m U.S. Army Corporal Emma Malonelord and I answered my calling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. Now let’s compare that to what the Russians are putting out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesus. Oh my God. By Russian is a little rusty? But the scared the thought -- I actually thought that the first ad wasn’t bad but it’s very touchy feely. Should we be embarrassed about our privates?

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: Look, I found the cartoon animation to be a little bit strange. I think that just as an American citizen, I’m more concerned about military readiness than equality or inclusiveness. I don’t think that they’re mutually exclusive though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: What I was distracted by was this wedding. And you can ask Kat, I will attend any wedding even if I’m not technically invited.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: So, I kind of want to go hang out at a wedding like that. That seems sort of appealing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now, you were a cat’s wedding, weren’t you?

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: I was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: The flower girl was a guy. So --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, the flower girl was a guy.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: In heels. And it was not, just to clarify.

utterances.speaker: BILL HEMMER, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: So, the flower girl was not god, it was not it was a guy.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: It was one of her, one of her buddies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, let’s try to get back on point, Bill. I don’t know you have to (INAUDIBLE) these topics.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: My feeling is, I mean, half of me thinks whatever works. And half of me thinks I, you know, there’s a lot of tough Marines who want to eat your face.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: And probably will go for a different spot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, what do you, so how do you -- I mean, if you were in charge, which ad would you prefer to use?

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I would use option number two.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: And I’d say (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, wow.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The only Russian you know,

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I have probably three words. I get by with that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I think it’s interesting. Can you say whether or not this would be a campaign that would be used in the CIA or the U.S. military if Trump had won a second term?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, he probably rail against it. He’ll probably make a tweet.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: I think the answer’s no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. So, here’s a theory, I do realize you’re probably comparing something that’s internal. I don’t know. Maybe that was Russian internal to, to there, to get people to join. So, I always get -- I’m getting the feeling that this this touchy feeliness is a protection racket, so that people will let -- be less inclined to think of the military as something dangerous. Does that make sense?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.utterance: I mean, it could be, it depends on also what they’re recruiting for. So, we had that CIA video before. And one of the things that a retired CIA agent told me is that that you need to, that ad was focusing on Latina women. OK. So, the reason is because apparently China is kicking our rear ends in Latin America, and they need to recruit people that will be able to blend in when they’re undercover. So, I don’t know what they’re recruiting for, and this young woman that said she found her calling, she’s working for the military. Maybe she’s a cybersecurity expert --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- and can figure out how to kick the butts of Dark Side.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: Oh, you think I might be smart?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don’t know. I don’t know what they’re recruiting for but I have a feeling they wouldn’t be wasting their time.

utterances.speaker: BENSON
utterances.utterance: There’s got to be analytics behind it, right? Or some explanation beyond just pure wokeness?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or could be like cartoons

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Could be. Animators.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes. Although, I got to say, that, Kat, maybe because it’s I’m a masculine male, that I was --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Very masculine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very masculine. I was taken by the Russian ad. Well, it spoke to me.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes. Seeing any sort of woke anything is always kind of weird, but especially this one you’re watching it and it’s all you know, identity politics and girl power and, and fluffy and you’re watching it you remind yourself, this is a recruitment ad for the world’s most powerful killing machine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that’s my point. Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And then it gets a little weirder and also I just married a veteran so like as someone who’s half-veteran.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you for your service.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, half-veteran. No, half-veteran by marriage. Obviously, I do not mean that. But I’ve talked to him a little bit about his experience serving in the military and he tells me stories I got to say, sounds pretty hard. Like, so this stuff you had to do? I’m like, what? You know, like you had to do that? And it sounds so crazy. So, I just think that you know, she’s explaining it as something she did. You know, how could you possibly do that? She said, she did it because you know, her sorority life wasn’t fulfilling and she wanted adventure and her sorority sister was in Italy. I feel like the way my husband explained it to me and I think the way most people would explain it is that you do it for a reason other than yourself and putting your country over yourself and that wasn’t mentioned here at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why didn’t he re-up your husband?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Oh, he didn’t re-up? Oh, I don’t know, because he didn’t want to.

utterances.speaker: HEMMER
utterances.utterance: He want to spend time with, Kat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, not much of a veteran, maybe a half a veteran.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, (INAUDIBLE) now 50/50 because we got married.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, I identify as a veteran without ever serving. Just so you know. All right. Up next, a host who faked being fun, and now her show is done.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: On camera she laughed, while she badgered her staff. And so, all good things must end. And also the Ellen DeGeneres Show. Yes, the 83-year- old entertainer just announced that the upcoming 19th season of her show will be its last. Apparently, she created a workplace more toxic than an Amazon warehouse in Chernobyl. Countless allegations surfaced last summer that the show’s work environment was rife with harassment and discrimination. Following those charges, Ellen’s ratings dropped faster than Kevin Spacey’s pants at a boy band pool party. Try to say that fast. But Ellen told the today’s show, home of Matt Lauer that the bad press, the bad press actually had nothing to do with her decision. Right. And the Titanic didn’t hit an iceberg, it chose to sink.

utterances.speaker: ELLEN DEGENERES, T.V. HOST
utterances.utterance: If it was while I was quitting, I would have not come back this year. I really did think about not coming back because it did, you know, I mean, it was devastating. I am a kind of person, I am a person who likes to make people happy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, the real reason she says is it was just too easy telling the Hollywood reporter, "When you’re a creative person, you constantly need to be challenged, and as great as this show is and as fun as it is, it’s just not a challenge anymore." Well, that’s true. Here’s an idea, when your viewership is down to 43 percent, why not consider that that challenge? Enemy time to make sure that my staff isn’t pissed at me like Ellen, I had my assistant James, ask them how stuff is going so far.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: So, how’s Greg been behind the scenes lately?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
